{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Expanded Program on Immunization (EPI) schedule includes vaccines that are given to children at different ages to protect them from various diseases. DPT vaccine protects against diphtheria, pertussis, and tetanus. MMR vaccine protects against measles, mumps, and rubella. BCG vaccine protects against tuberculosis. OPV is the oral polio vaccine. All these vaccines are included in the EPI schedule.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
